targets.expr: sum by(queue_name) (rate(audius_cn_jobs_completed_total{environment=~"$env", queue_name=~"$queue", host=~"$host"}[1h])) / (sum by(queue_name) (rate(audius_cn_jobs_failed_total{environment=~"$env", queue_name=~"$queue", host=~"$host"}[1h])) + sum by(queue_name) (rate(audius_cn_jobs_completed_total{environment=~"$env", queue_name=~"$queue", host=~"$host"}[1h])))

sum by(host) (rate(audius_cn_jobs_completed_total{environment=~"$env", queue_name=~"$queue", host=~"$host"}[1h])) / (sum by(host) (rate(audius_cn_jobs_failed_total{environment=~"$env", queue_name=~"$queue", host=~"$host"}[1h])) + sum by(host) (rate(audius_cn_jobs_completed_total{environment=~"$env", queue_name=~"$queue", host=~"$host"}[1h])))

panels.description: The number of bull jobs waiting to be executed --- if the number of waiting jobs is skyrocketing, it might mean that too many are being created OR that the jobs for that specific queue are taking too long to execute
panels.title: Waiting Queue Jobs by Queue

panels.description: The number of bull jobs waiting to be executed --- if the number of waiting jobs is skyrocketing, it might mean that too many are being created OR that the jobs for that specific queue are taking too long to execute
panels.title: Waiting Queue Jobs by Host

panels.description:
The number of bull jobs waiting to be executed.

---

If the number of waiting jobs is skyrocketing, it might mean:

* Too many are being created.
* The jobs for that specific queue are taking too long to execute.
panels.title: Waiting Queue Jobs

targets.expr: histogram_quantile($percentile, sum by(le, queue_name) (rate(audius_cn_jobs_duration_seconds_bucket{environment=~"$env", queue_name=~"$queue", host=~"$host", status="completed"}[$__rate_interval])))
histogram_quantile($percentile, sum by(le, queue_name) (rate(audius_cn_jobs_duration_seconds_bucket{environment=~"$env", queue_name=~"$queue", host=~"$host", status="failed"}[$__rate_interval])))
histogram_quantile($percentile, sum by(le, host) (rate(audius_cn_jobs_duration_seconds_bucket{environment=~"$env", queue_name=~"$queue", host=~"$host", status!="failed"}[1h])))
histogram_quantile($percentile, sum by(le, host) (rate(audius_cn_jobs_duration_seconds_bucket{environment=~"$env", queue_name=~"$queue", host=~"$host", status="failed"}[$__rate_interval])))
